Their stories are just four of many and that’s why it’s my hope that my bill to #EndForcedArbitration is signed into law soon. 
 
Their stories have sparked change – I’m proud to have them as my #SOTU guests. By lifting the voices of our survivors, we can #BuildBackBetter.

1498807756014465035.text:
Tanuja, like millions of women in the workplace, experienced sexual harassment. She took action into her own hands.
 
As the founder of Googlers for Ending Forced Arbitration, she helped in ending Google’s mandatory arbitration clause for past, current and future employees. https://t.co/26Hqn1d5r7

1498807168023334913.text:
Lora’s testimony before Congress told the story of the sexual abuse she faced from her boss, time and time again. Instead of taking action against her attacker, they fired her.
 
Because she had entered into a forced arbitration agreement, she couldn’t pursue legal action. https://t.co/bCaBayBx7W

1498807014302130177.text:
Tatiana’s Congressional testimony told the story of the repeated sexual assault and harassment she faced by her CEO. She feared not only for her career, but her life. 
 
Because she had entered into a forced arbitration agreement, she couldn’t pursue legal action. https://t.co/tz6gl9lcZm

1498806887806119941.text:
Andowah testified before Congress after experiencing multiple instances of sexual assault by her supervisor. While she was treated like the villain, her attacker was promoted. 
 
Because she had entered into a forced arbitration agreement, she couldn’t pursue legal action. https://t.co/rVIwZfMTKu

1491914710261940234.text: This week, my bill passed the House floor with 113 Republicans voting for the bill. With this bipartisan support, Leader @SenSchumer and @SenatorDurbin got the bill on the Senate floor today where it passed UNANIMOUSLY!

1491914592053870593.text: I reintroduced the bill in the 116th and 117th Congress, and in 2021, it finally received a hearing in @JudiciaryDems and @HouseJudiciary! During these hearings, victims testified about their experiences with forced arbitration and workplace sexual assault and harassment.

1491914449258782725.text: As we worked to rally support for the bill, 56 Attorneys General from all 50 states, territories and D.C. called for its passage in 2018.   Soon, tech giants, like Microsoft and Uber, took action and removed forced arbitration clauses buried in their employment documents.

1491914335890731010.text: I knew right away that we needed to put a stop to this insidious practice. After working with my team to craft legislation, we first introduced the Ending Forced Arbitration of Sexual Harassment Act in December 2017!

1491914216487460867.text:

1479128780585283588.text: This moment in our history will continue to serve as a stark reminder that democracy is never a guarantee.  It’s fragile, and it's up to all of us to treasure and protect it.  At the end of that long, dark night, democracy prevailed. Let's make sure it never fails.

1479128652394778627.text: The Capitol was stormed and our democracy — the foundation of America — was threatened.

1479128557829996545.text: “Get your gas masks out.”  That’s what I heard as an angry mob crashed through the House Floor’s glass windows.  It was Jan 6 and I was at the Capitol working to certify the 2020 election results — my constitutional duty. The violence forced us to pause our work.

1478817098780577810.text:
"This is what we do: We stay and report."

#SOTU #SOTU2020

1224912861601980416.text: I continue to stand ready to work with the President on bipartisan priorities like lowering the cost of prescription drugs, rebuilding our infrastructure, investing in broadband and expanding career and technical education.

1224912860888870912.text:
Americans need more than just assurances. They demand action.

The State of the Union should be a unique opportunity to unite Americans. Tonight’s address missed the mark.

1224912860201005061.text: The state of our health care is anything but strong. This Administration put Americans’ health security on the chopping block by threatening those with pre-existing conditions and failing for the past three years to fulfill promises to lower prescription drug prices.

1224912859362144257.text:
I just walked out of the House chamber after the #SOTU.

Tonight, President Trump spoke about a Great American comeback. But too many who wrestle with soaring drug prices, crumbling infrastructure and an uncertain economic future still feel like they are falling further behind.

1195819291888824321.text:
I thank @VetAffairsDems for passing this legislation out of committee recently and will continue to fight for it until it becomes law. 

Our veterans and Gold Star families have already sacrificed far too much. We have an obligation to provide them our support.

1195819290739515392.text: This additional bill would extend home & automobile leasing protections by allowing the spouses of catastrophically injured servicemembers to terminate property leases and automobile leases, and Gold Star spouses to terminate automobile leases.

1195819289258995712.text: It brings me great pride to say this bill was signed into law last year and I hope it will bring some relief to our Gold Star families among difficult times. But this Congress, I introduced a second piece of legislation to take it another step further.

1195819288109686784.text: No Gold Star family should experience that additional hardship while making the best decision for their family. So, thanks to Kylie's story, I introduced legislation that allows Gold Star spouses to terminate residential leases following a servicemember's death without penalty.

1195819287019237377.text: In particular, the story of the Riney Family from Farmington, IL has always stuck with me. Kylie Riney lost her husband Sgt. Douglas Riney and was confronted with costly lease cancellation fees when she moved her family back to IL from TX where her husband was stationed.

1195819285874200576.text: I was honored to have the opportunity to express my gratitude and participate in this ceremony of remembrance – especially as we approach the holiday season and bring the week of Veterans Day to a close. Our Gold Star families have inspired me.

1195819281855975430.text: The Annual Fallen Heroes Tree of Honor Dedication in Peoria is such a moving tribute to our Gold Star families & their loved ones who paid the ultimate sacrifice in defense of the freedoms and values we all hold dear. https://t.co/mHo3r4wBrH

1185268562107260930.text: I urge the VA to take a hard look at how this inconsistent policy deters veterans, because I’m sure the veterans of Northwest & Central Illinois aren't alone. I thank the veterans who have raised this issue and will continue to work to alleviate this potential burden.

1185268561188655105.text: This unnecessary red tape forces our veterans to jump through additional hoops when they’re simply seeking the services they need. Our goal should be to make the process as efficient and effective as possible to eliminate additional difficulties like assistance delays.

1185268560249184258.text: This additional hurdle has left veterans frustrated and concerned with the VA’s process and can even lead to veterans giving up on getting help instead of seeking assistance. Our veterans have earned nothing short of the best care and we owe it to them to deliver it.

1185268559276105728.text: Veterans seeking assistance have been repeatedly forced to re-sign Privacy Act Release forms that they have previously completed and are under no obligation to resubmit. As a result, veterans are often forced to travel to sign a new form in person or complete them via mail.

1185268557497679872.text: I just sent a letter to the @DeptVetAffairs urging them to address inconsistencies in their casework process. 1176654580341514240.text: Both Democrats and Republicans should want to get to the bottom of whether the President put our national security at risk for his own political gain.

1176654579481632768.text: Today’s action is a measured step to ensure the American people get the truth and the answers they deserve. This is a fact-finding mission.

1176561329773195266.text: I support the work of my colleagues on the Intelligence Committee and House Leadership as they work to uncover the truth and ensure no one conducts our nation’s business outside the boundaries of our laws.

1176561328745582594.text: The American people deserve the truth and the Director of National Intelligence must either stand up for our Democracy, or be complicit in hiding that truth.

1176561327743078400.text: The President and his administration’s choice to bury this report is a clear violation of law and order in our nation, which relies on the rule of law to preserve our Democracy.

1176561326749048833.text: We are witnessing in real time disturbing conduct and what clearly looks to be an abuse of power from the President of the United States. I call for a bipartisan approach to a complete, thorough and unimpeded investigation of the whistleblower’s report.
